meanings.definition: Show or prove to be right or reasonable.
meanings.sent1: She tried to justify her actions by explaining her reasons.
meanings.sent2: The evidence presented in court helped to justify his innocence.
meanings.sent3: He tried to justify eating ice cream for breakfast by saying it was a dairy product.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work and dedication justified her promotion to manager.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used examples to justify her answer and make it clear.

meanings.sent1: His illness was enough to justify his absence from work.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain could justify canceling the outdoor event.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies could justify breaking the diet.
meanings.sent4: The stunning view from the top of the mountain justified the long hike.
meanings.sent5: The urgent situation justified the need for immediate action.

meanings.definition: Adjust the spaces between words in a line of type to fill the line.
meanings.sent1: The typesetter had to justify the text to make it fit perfectly on the page.
meanings.sent2: When formatting the document, remember to justify the text for a clean look.
meanings.sent3: The designer had to justify the text to avoid awkward gaps between words.
meanings.sent4: To create a professional document, always remember to justify the text properly.
meanings.sent5: Justify the text to ensure a neat and organized appearance of the page.
